name: chatgpt_prod_offshore_gdb_fz_c5m
description: [GPT Prod] Offshore + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK (C3 vs C5-M), suggest RF/SF
query: We require GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for an offshore platform. Airflow: 3,400 m¬≥/h. The unit will be exposed to salty sea air (C5-M). Please confirm compliance.

turns.content: We require GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for an offshore platform. Airflow: 3,400 m¬≥/h. The unit will be exposed to salty sea air (C5-M). Please confirm compliance.

For the offshore platform application, the GDB filter housing is not suitable due to the marine environment. The single-wall uninsulated construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.The system will be exposed to Salt Spray, Outdoor Condensation, and High Humidity. Salt spray accelerates corrosion on the C2-rated galvanized steel (FZ) housing. Outdoor condensation will form on the housing's non-insulated metal surfaces. Marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance.I recommend a two-stage filtration system:Stage 1 will use a GDP Planfiltersk√•p as a PROTECTOR to pre-filter the air. Stage 2 will use a GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p as the TARGET filter. The GDMI is approved for marine environments.To finalize the configuration, I need two details:Minimum Ambient Temperature: What is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site?Relative Humidity: What is the typical relative humidity at the site?

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical engineering flaw in the user's request: using a standard galvanized (C2) housing in a severe offshore marine environment (C5). It blocks the unsafe configuration, cites the correct corrosion class from the PDF, and proposes a technically sound alternative (insulated GDMI housing) while asking for relevant environmental parameters.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as C2-rated galvanized steel (PDF p.8) and determines it is unsuitable for C5 marine environments.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the safety risk, blocks the request, suggests a specific alternative (GDP+GDMI), and asks for necessary design parameters.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety intervention; prevents rapid corrosion failure of the equipment on an offshore platform.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative regarding the safety block.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear, logical deduction: GDB is uninsulated/C2 (PDF data) -> Offshore is C5/Corrosive -> Material mismatch -> Block.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to corrosion class limitations defined in the catalog and standard engineering practice.

strengths: Correctly identifies the specific corrosion class (C2) for GDB from PDF page 8
Applies sound engineering judgment to block uninsulated housings in marine environments
Proposes a valid multi-stage alternative (GDP pre-filter + GDMI target filter)
pdf_citations: GDB material: 'GDB tillverkas vanligen i f√∂rzinkat. Korrosivitets klass C2.' (PDF p.8)
GDMI construction: 'GDMI √§r ett v√§rme- och kondensisolerat modulfiltersk√•p.' (PDF p.11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that a standard GDB in galvanized steel is a poor choice for an offshore C5-M environment, but it makes several incorrect or unsupported claims (leakage/hygiene linkage, GDMI ‚Äúapproved for marine‚Äù) and proposes an odd GDP+GDMI alternative without tying it to the user‚Äôs carbon/chemical or offshore constraints. It also asks for temperature/RH but doesn‚Äôt explain how those inputs would change the housing/material selection, and it never confirms compliance as requested.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF verifies GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and is described for inomhusbruk with korrosivitetsklass C2, but the claim that GDMI is ‚Äúapproved for marine environments‚Äù and that single-wall construction fails leakage/hygiene for marine is not supported and is partly incorrect engineering framing.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Does not answer the compliance question directly (e.g., material/corrosion class mismatch vs C5-M) and does not provide a compliant alternative material (e.g., ZM/RF/SF) for the requested GDB form factor or an outdoor-rated solution.
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately blocks galvanized/C2 housing for salty sea air exposure and highlights corrosion/condensation risks, though it could more clearly recommend C5 materials (ZM/RF/SF) and outdoor weather protection measures.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, with clear warning/blocking language appropriate for technical sales engineering.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning about salt spray corrosion and condensation is generally sound, but it contains logical jumps (marine environment ‚â† hygiene requirement) and the proposed GDP+GDMI staging is not well-justified for the stated need.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates catalog/application constraints by implying GDMI suitability/approval for marine/offshore when the PDF states inomhusbruk, and it recommends GDP (also inomhusbruk) as part of an offshore solution without addressing enclosure/weatherproofing.

strengths: Correctly identifies that FZ/C2 (and even C3 galvanizing) is unsuitable for C5-M offshore salt-spray exposure and blocks the configuration.
Requests additional environmental parameters (temperature/RH), which is a reasonable clarification step for condensation/corrosion risk assessment.
weaknesses: Introduces unsupported claims (GDMI ‚Äúapproved for marine‚Äù, leakage/hygiene noncompliance) and conflates marine exposure with hygiene requirements.

Alternative recommendation is not aligned with the offshore/outdoor constraint (GDP/GDMI are specified for indoor use in the PDF) and does not propose the obvious compliant material options (ZM/RF/SF) or protective measures.

GDB: 'F√∂r inomhusbruk' and 'tillverkas vanligen i f√∂rzinkat. Korrosivitets klass C2' (GDB product description page).

content_segments.text: For the offshore platform application, the GDB filter housing is not suitable due to the marine environment. The single-wall uninsulated construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.
content_segments.inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_MARINE installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: The system will be exposed to Salt Spray, Outdoor Condensation, and High Humidity. Salt spray accelerates corrosion on the C2-rated galvanized steel (FZ) housing. Outdoor condensation will form on the housing's non-insulated metal surfaces. Marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance.
content_segments.inference_logic: Marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance (acid-proof stainless). Outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces. Double-wall insulated housing required to maintain surface above dew point.

content_segments.text: I recommend a two-stage filtration system:
Stage 1 will use a GDP Planfiltersk√•p as a PROTECTOR to pre-filter the air. Stage 2 will use a GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p as the TARGET filter. The GDMI is approved for marine environments.
To finalize the configuration, I need two details:
Minimum Ambient Temperature: What is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site?
Relative Humidity: What is the typical relative humidity at the site?
